notes.text: By flooding the target resolver with queries exploiting this flaw an attacker can significantly impair the resolver's performance, effectively denying legitimate clients access to the DNS resolution service.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: The underlying bug might cause read past end of the buffer and either read memory it should not read, or crash the process.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: An attacker can leverage this flaw to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources. Upon restart the attacker would have to begin again, but nevertheless there is the potential to deny service.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: By sending specific queries to the resolver, an attacker can cause named to crash.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed EdDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
